<link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;c2cdadd4.1501</link>   <description> The other guest editors and I are very excited to present this special issue. We hope you will consider contributing.<br><br>Best,<br>Yon Visell<br><br>Call for Papers<br>IEEE Transactions on Haptics<br>Special Issue on Active Touch Sensing in Robots, Humans, and Other Animals<br><br>Submission deadline: April 1 2015<br>First decision to authors: June 1 2015<br><br>Complete Details: http://re-touch-lab.com/ieee-toh-issue<br><br>Guest Editors: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-22T09:55:50-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>yon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;c2cdadd4.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;d4e11231.1501">   <title>[meetings] Living Machines IV: Second Call for Papers, Satellite Events and Sponsors </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;d4e11231.1501</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;d4e11231.1501">[meetings] Living Machines IV: Second Call for Papers, Satellite Events and Sponsors </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-01-22T09:10:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nathan F Lepora</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;d4e11231.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;86a44e04.1501">   <title>statistics course - ADVANCING IN R </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;86a44e04.1501</link>   <description> STATISTICS COURSE 'ADVANCING IN R'<br><br>A repeat of the course titled 'ADVANCING IN R' has been arranged for 30th November \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 4th December 2015<br><br>The content designed to bridge the gap between basic R coding and more advanced statistical modelling. The course is aimed at PhD students and post docs (although people at any stage of their career are welcome) with basic to moderate knowledge in R. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-12T21:11:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oliver Hooker</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;86a44e04.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;486c7618.1501">   <title>THE ENCYCLOPEDIA OF DECISION SCIENCES </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;486c7618.1501</link>   <description> We are inviting academic editorial contributors to The SAGE Encyclopedia of<br>Decision Sciences, a new 3-volume reference to be published in 2016. A<br>description of the project is as follows:<br><br>The study of decision making and problem solving explores the cognitive,<br>social, and economic aspects of judgment and behavior, particularly in<br>situations with risk or uncertainty. Theories and research findings from<br>decision science have broad application in such areas as Psychology,<br>Business and Management, Finance, Economics, Medicine and Healthcare,<br>Computer Science, Behavior Analysis, and Law. This encyclopedia looks to<br>answer questions such as: How does risky decision making in adolescence<br> [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-08T13:08:44-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Melodie Hagspiel</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;486c7618.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;7dc7e85e.1501">   <title>THE ENCYCLOPEDIA OF DECISION SCIENCES CALL FOR AUTHORS </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;7dc7e85e.1501</link>   <description> We are inviting academic editorial contributors to The SAGE Encyclopedia of Decision Sciences, a new 3-volume reference to be published in 2016. A description of the project is as follows:<br><br>The study of decision making and problem solving explores the cognitive, social, and economic aspects of judgment and behavior, particularly in situations with risk or uncertainty. Theories and research findings from decision science have broad application in such areas as Psychology, Business and Management, Finance, Economics, Medicine and Healthcare, Computer Science, Behavior Analysis, and Law. This encyclopedia looks to answer questions such as: How does risky decision making in adolescence [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-08T15:53:19+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Melodie Hagspiel</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;7dc7e85e.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;74886f7.1501">   <title>Re: new book </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;74886f7.1501</link>   <description> Dear Olga,<br><br>Thank you for the information. manager,<br>>le designer\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, qu'il soit [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-06T09:26:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>George Jeronimidis</dc:creator> qu'il soit exp\ufffd\ufffdriment\ufffd\ufffd ou d\ufffd\ufffdbutant.<br>Le &quot;Manuel de l'Inventeur&quot; inclut aussi plusieurs conseils d'innovation<br>d\ufffd\ufffdriv\ufffd\ufffds de la nature, p.ex. &quot;Comment simplifier la complexit\ufffd\ufffd et trouver<br> [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-05T14:47:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Olga Bogatyreva</dc:creator> href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;ef326925.1411">[meetings] Living Machines IV: First Call for Papers, Satellite Events and Sponsors </a></description>   <dc:date>2014-11-25T17:35:38+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nathan F Lepora</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;ef326925.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;e1eab77b.1411">   <title>Re: Your opinion on future EU R&I policy requested - 'Invitation for Registration: E-Consultation on Nature-Based Solutions' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;e1eab77b.1411</link>   <description> That was exactly my point - they didn't, but we can...<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Adrian<br><br>Dr Adrian Bowyer<br>http://adrianbowyer.net<br><br>On 06/11/14 10:57, Adrian Thomas wrote:<br>&gt; Except that Cyanobacteria didn’t create millions - billions - of new species, they remain a<br>&gt; relatively low diversity (if ubiquitous) group. The billions of new species arose from other<br>&gt; distantly-related prokaryotes, eukaryotes and archaea who were able to either tolerate the oxygen<br>&gt; pollution, escape to unpolluted niches, or exploit the new opportunity it offered.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Adrian<br>&gt;<br>&gt; On 6 Nov 2014, at 09:37, Adrian Bowyer &lt;ab@ADRIANBOWYER.NET &lt;mailto:ab@ADRIANBOWYER.NET&gt;&gt; wrote:<br>&gt;<br>>> [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-06T11:12:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adrian Bowyer</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;e1eab77b.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;ca79318a.1411">   <title>Re: Your opinion on future EU R&I policy requested - 'Invitation for Registration: E-Consultation on Nature-Based Solutions' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;ca79318a.1411</link>   <description> Except that Cyanobacteria didn’t create millions - billions - of new species, they remain a relatively low diversity (if ubiquitous) group. The billions of new species arose from other distantly-related prokaryotes, eukaryotes and archaea who were able to either tolerate the oxygen pollution, escape to unpolluted niches, or exploit the new opportunity it offered. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-06T10:57:48+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adrian Thomas</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;ca79318a.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;b45b5625.1411">   <title>Re: Your opinion on future EU R&I policy requested - 'Invitation for Registration: E-Consultation on Nature-Based Solutions' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;b45b5625.1411</link>   <description> Is it possible to look too far downstream?<br><br>But I agree with Steve on both counts. However, it seems to me that his second paragraph is a<br>pretty exact description of the cyanobacteria's arrival as well.<br><br>There is one important difference between the cyanobacteria and us: in my scenario the one species<br>left standing has the ability to create millions - billions - of new species in the geological blink<br>of an eye. We would be starting with a clean slate, and we would have a direct fall-back source of<br>energy in case it all goes wrong so we can [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-06T09:37:30+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adrian Bowyer</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;b45b5625.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;19d50290.1411">   <title>Re: Your opinion on future EU R&I policy requested - 'Invitation for Registration: E-Consultation on Nature-Based Solutions' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;19d50290.1411</link>   <description> I'd add two comments, both making the point (as did Julian) that blaming efficient solar cells is looking too far downstream. First, and less important, one can safely assume a continuing human addiction to thermodynamically high-quality energy; assuming that, the solar cells are far from the worst of the depredations we inflict on our surroundings. Second, it seems clear to me that the fundamental ecological disaster consists of the human pandemic, in which one species (1) sequesters a truly unprecedented fraction of the earth's primary biological productivity and (2) produces effluents that preclude the possibility of anything remotely close to [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-05T18:39:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Steven Vogel, Ph.D.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;19d50290.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;f4eb3de7.1411">   <title>Re: Your opinion on future EU R&I policy requested - 'Invitation for Registration: E-Consultation on Nature-Based Solutions' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;f4eb3de7.1411</link>   <description> Nice one, Adrian!<br><br>There's at least one problem: solar panels are, at least in part, a response to the problems of generating readily available energy without producing (much - anyone know how much) extra CO2 which is currently rated as the biggest - and most pervasive - game changer. I don't think that the percentage efficiency of PV is relevant, except insofar as it can replace CO2 generation (or rather, regeneration, since it comes from reversing the originating chemical processes which God put in place when he invented nature's landfill) more efficiently than wind or tidal energy sources.<br>And it [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-05T18:05:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Julian Vincent</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;f4eb3de7.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;50691478.1411">   <title>Re: Fwd: Your opinion on future EU R&I policy requested - 'Invitation for Registration: E-Consultation on Nature-Based Solutions' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;50691478.1411</link>   <description> I'm not free on 12 November, I'm afraid. But here's my two-cent's worth:<br><br>Thinking of nature-based solutions, there is a nature-based problem that no one seems to have noticed.<br><br>What's the biggest ecological disaster that has ever happened? The asteroid that caused the<br>Cretaceous\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdPaleogene extinction 65 mya? No - much worse was the evolution of the photosynthesising<br>cyanobacteria about 3 billion years ago. They poisoned almost every other living organism with<br>oxygen. Uniquely they didn't need those other organisms because they had a direct line to the sun,<br>so the predator-prey balance that now keeps everything from typhoid to lions [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-05T17:43:40+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adrian Bowyer</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;50691478.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;d1f1c0c1.1411">   <title>Fwd: Your opinion on future EU R&I policy requested - 'Invitation for Registration: E-Consultation on Nature-Based Solutions' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;d1f1c0c1.1411</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>As you may know I'm currently member of the H2020 Advisory Group on Societal Challenge #5: &quot;Climate action, environment, energy efficiency and raw materials&quot; and core member of the subgroup &quot;Nature Based Solutions&quot;.<br><br>The European Commission, in co-operation with the European Platform for Biodiversity Research Strategy, invites you to contribute your opinion to the framing of the future EU Research &amp; Innovation policy on Nature-Based Solutions. The consultation is an online dialogue of maximum 80 minutes and takes place on 12 Nov. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-05T10:38:37+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Saskia van den Muijsenberg</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;d1f1c0c1.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;17d15af5.1410">   <title>job opportunity </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;17d15af5.1410</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>As part of a substantial expansion in the biological sciences, the School of Biology at Georgia Tech is seeking applications for biologists engaged in understanding the functional properties of bio-materials, and with interest in using this knowledge to produce novel and sustainable materials for technical applications. The primary appointment is in biology, but with the possibility of adjunct or split positions in materials science or mechanical engineering. Georgia Tech has a vibrant group of individuals in many departments that share the goal of understanding how biological systems can help inform human technology. Biology is the home of Ga [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-09T13:45:21-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Weissburg, Marc J</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;17d15af5.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;43c0ea0c.1410">   <title>Advancing in 'R' statistics course </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;43c0ea0c.1410</link>   <description> There are still a handful of places left for the 'advancing in R' statistics course being held in December at SCENE (the Scottish Center for Ecology and the Natural Environment), Glasgow, United Kingdom.<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdAdvancing in R\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd is designed to bridge the gap between basic R coding and more advanced statistical modelling. It will cover model selection and simplification methods, likelihood ratio tests, mixed effect models, Generalised Linear Models (GLM\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds) (binomial and count data), nonlinear models (polynomial &amp; mechanistic models) and how to combine these methods (e.g., nonlinear mixed effect (NLME) models &amp; generalised linear mixed effect (GLMM) models) [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-07T19:32:50+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oliver Hooker</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;43c0ea0c.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;88ada327.1408">   <title>PhD position link </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;88ada327.1408</link>   <description> Hi John (and everyone else! :-),<br><br>Thanks for the pointer. Here's the full link to the University's &quot;jobs&quot; page.<br><br>http://www.hochschule-rhein-waal.de/en/informationsnavigation/job-offer/scientific-assitants.html<br><br>My position is the first one on the list.<br><br>These modern URLs aren't really keyboard or twitter friendly, hence the bit.ly link I sent earlier.<br><br>Cheers,<br>William<br><br>Prof William Megill, PhD, CMarSci, FIMarEST<br>Professor of Bionics<br>Rhine Waal University of Applied Sciences<br>william.megill@hsrw.eu    </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-27T17:35:26+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Megill, William M, Prof. Dr.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;88ada327.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;6df3d18e.1408">   <title>Re: PhD position in underwater biomimetics </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;6df3d18e.1408</link>   <description> Dear William:<br><br>Greetings. Hope this finds you well. Sounds like an interesting position.<br>The advertisement is a pdf that downloads automatically. If you can direct<br>me to a web page with the same ad -- or your lab site with the ad posted --<br>that will be a better link for me to tweet and post. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-26T07:27:44-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>John Long</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;6df3d18e.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;d63ec307.1408">   <title>PhD position in underwater biomimetics </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;d63ec307.1408</link>   <description> Good evening all,<br><br>I have a PhD position just come open in underwater biomimetics. My lab (previously part of the Centre for Biomimetic and Natural Technologies at the University of Bath) at the Rhine Waal University of Applied Sciences in Cleves, Germany, is focused on underwater locomotion and sensing. We're looking for a mechanical engineer to develop novel propulsion systems for small biomimetic underwater robots. Thesis topics would be around fluid dynamics, soft robot mechanics and control, or other underwater propulsion biomimetics. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-25T20:18:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Megill, William M, Prof. Dr.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;d63ec307.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;380728a7.1408">   <title>SUSTAINABLE DESIGN BRAZILIAN SYMPOSIUM </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;380728a7.1408</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;380728a7.1408">SUSTAINABLE DESIGN BRAZILIAN SYMPOSIUM </a></description>   <dc:date>2014-08-22T14:20:01+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Designer Marcio Dupont</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOMIMETICS;380728a7.1408</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
